text: Employee well-being and engagement are increasingly recognized as central to HR’s purpose. Beyond traditional administrative and strategic functions, HR focuses on creating programs and policies that support physical, mental, and emotional health, work-life balance, and overall job satisfaction. This includes implementing wellness programs, flexible work arrangements, employee assistance programs, recognition initiatives, and career development opportunities. Engaged employees are more productive, committed, and likely to contribute positively to organizational outcomes, making employee engagement a key metric of HR effectiveness.
